translations.translation: He inquired, 'What, then, is your business, messengers?'
He said: "What is then your business, O messengers?"
Abraham said: “Envoys (of Allah), what is your errand?”
Abraham asked, "Messengers, what is your task?"
Said Ibrahim, “What is your task, O the sent angels?”
(Ibrahim) said: "Then for what purpose you have come, O messengers"
He said: What is your affair then, O apostles!
Said he, 'And what is your business, envoys?'
(Abraham) said: And (afterward) what is your errand, O ye sent (from Allah)?
Abraham asked, "What is your errand, O messengers?"
He said: what then is your errand! O ye sent ones!
He said, ‘O messengers, what is now your errand?’
(Abraham) said: "And what, O ye Messengers, is your errand (now)?"
[Ibrahim (Abraham)] said: "Then for what purpose you have come, O Messengers?"
Messengers' said he (Abraham), 'what is your errand'
He said, “What is your business, O envoys?”
[Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"
[51:31] He said, ‘So what is your business, O you who have been sent [by God]?’
((Abraham) said: And (afterward) what is your errand) what is happening and why have you come, (0 ye sent (from Allah)?

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ } معناه فما أَمْركُم

translations.translation: And His saying, "What is your command?" means, "What is your affair?"

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
وبعدما جرى منهم ما جرى
 أخذ إبراهيم عليه السلام يسأل عن سبب نزولهم وإرسالهم { قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ } وشأنكم الذي جئتم لأجله { أَيُّهَا ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ } [الذاريات: 31]

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ قال فما خطبكم } أي: فما شأنكم وما طِلبتكم وفيمَ أُرسلتم؟ { أيها المرسَلون } هل أُرسلتم بالبشارة خاصة
 أو لأمر آخر
